provinces.name: Alberta
provinces.randomFact: Alberta is home to the famous Banff National Park, one of the oldest national parks in the world.

provinces.name: British Columbia
provinces.randomFact: British Columbia has the mildest climate in Canada and is known for its stunning coastline and mountains.

provinces.name: Manitoba
provinces.randomFact: Manitoba is home to over 100,000 lakes, including the famous Lake Winnipeg, one of the largest freshwater lakes in the world.

provinces.name: New Brunswick
provinces.randomFact: New Brunswick is known for the highest tides in the world at the Bay of Fundy.

provinces.name: Newfoundland and Labrador
provinces.randomFact: Newfoundland and Labrador is the only province in Canada with its own time zone.

provinces.name: Nova Scotia
provinces.randomFact: Nova Scotia is home to the world's highest tides in the Bay of Fundy.

provinces.name: Ontario
provinces.randomFact: Ontario is home to Niagara Falls, one of the most famous natural wonders in the world.

provinces.name: Prince Edward Island
provinces.randomFact: Prince Edward Island is known for its red sandy beaches and the fictional setting of Anne of Green Gables.

provinces.name: Quebec
provinces.randomFact: Quebec City is the only walled city in North America north of Mexico, and it's a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

provinces.name: Saskatchewan
provinces.randomFact: Saskatchewan is known as the 'Land of Living Skies' due to its vast prairies and stunning sunsets.
